abstract: If it follows through, Moody’s could reduce the ratings of Wall Street giants like Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan Chase as much as two grades.
snippet: If it follows through, Moody’s could reduce the ratings of Wall Street giants like Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan Chase as much as two grades.
lead_paragraph: Believing that the government is now more likely to let large banks fail in a crisis, Moody’s Investors Service threatened on Thursday to downgrade the credit ratings of several big financial firms.

headline.main: Moody’s Threatens to Cut Credit Ratings of Banks
headline.print_headline: Moody’s Threatens to Cut Credit Ratings of Banks

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
